oauth_demo

Class OauthClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • oauth_demo.OauthClient

  • public class OauthClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class which runs the Oauth demo client.

    It checks whether the access token file exists, and presents the user with a menu of relevant options.

    If the client has previously been authorised with Dropbox (ie the Dropbox token file exists), the options allow the user to manipulate files in the Dropbox app directory using Dropbox calls (not using filesystem I/O).

    If the client has not yet been authorised with Dropbox (ie the Dropbox token file does not exist), the options allow the user to run either the no-redirect or redirect workflows.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • oauthAuthoriseNoRedirect

        public static void oauthAuthoriseNoRedirect()
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                            com.dropbox.core.DbxException
        Run the Oauth no-redirect workflow.

        This consists of the following steps:

        1. Delete the access token file if it exists.
        2. Start the workflow by calling DropboxWorkflowNoRedirect.noRedirectClientStart().
        3. Open a browser window at the URL returned by noRedirectClientStart().
        4. Prompt the user to enter the authorisation code displayed by Dropbox in this window.
        5. Finish the workflow, save the access token and generate the sample files by calling DropboxWorkflowNoRedirect.noRedirectClientFinishAndSave().
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error saving the access token file
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if there is an error opening the start URL
        com.dropbox.core.DbxException - if a Dropbox error occurs
        See Also:
        DropboxWorkflowNoRedirect

      • oauthAuthoriseRedirect

        public static void oauthAuthoriseRedirect()
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          java.net.URISyntaxException
        Start the Oauth no-redirect workflow.

        This consists of the following steps:

        1. Delete the access token file if it exists.
        2. Start the workflow by calling DropboxWorkflowRedirect.redirectClientStart().
        3. Open a browser window at the URL returned by redirectClientStart().
        4. Wait for the access token file to be created by the HTTP server (which is running the finish step of the workflow).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error saving the access token file
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if there is an error opening the start URL
        See Also:
        DropboxWorkflowNoRedirect
